item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (491 points | 49 comments)
2. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (75 points | 53 comments)
3. Database mocks are just not worth it (47 points | 46 comments)
4. Execution units are often pipelined (122 points | 47 comments)
5. US credit card defaults jump to highest level since 2010 (98 points | 66 comments)
6. The Homa Network Protocol (9 points | discuss)
7. Curl-Impersonate (322 points | 74 comments)
8. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (48 points | 5 comments)
9. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (3 points | discuss)
10. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (119 points | 67 comments)
11. How Well Do LLMs Generate Code for Different Application Domains? (19 points | discuss)
12. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (361 points | 132 comments)
13. 'Obelisks': New Class of Life Has Been Found in Human Digestive System (222 points | 82 comments)
14. A simple way to explore data through a Tableau-like UI directly in your data app (73 points | 3 comments)
15. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (144 points | 44 comments)
16. Beyond BLE: Cracking Open the Black-Box of RF Microcontrollers [video] (79 points | 10 comments)
17. Ts_zip: Text Compression Using Large Language Models (68 points | 23 comments)
18. YouTuber won DMCA fight with fake Nintendo lawyer by detecting spoofed email (167 points | 69 comments)
19. RubyConf 2024: Cloud Native Buildpack Hackday (and other Ruby deploy tools, too) (3 points | discuss)
20. Where is James Bond? Trapped in an ugly stalemate with Amazon (73 points | 84 comments)
21. Empirical Study of Test Generation with LLM's (25 points | 7 comments)
22. Pincites (YC S23) is hiring a founding engineer to build legal AI agents (Remote) ( | hide)
23. Fun facts about SQLite (223 points | 98 comments)
24. Apple M5 could ditch unified memory architecture for split CPU and GPU designs (46 points | 17 comments)
25. Show HN: I built open source file sharing solution using AWS S3 (44 points | 20 comments)
26. A Tricycle of the Mind (10 points | 2 comments)
27. High-Speed Sequential DNA Computing Using a Solid-State DNA Origami Register (6 points | discuss)
28. Dungeons and Dragons rolls the dice with new rules about identity (35 points | 76 comments)
29. Bench to be acquired after abruptly shutting down (81 points | 58 comments)
30. What is it like to be a thermostat? (1996) (49 points | 64 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
